page.title: 09PLACES OF WORSHIP
page.content: There is a Church of England church in both villages, but services are held only once a month. The priest in charge of Woodeaton is the Rev. D.R. Westcott who lives in Islip Rectory. The priest in charge of Elsfield is the Rev. A. De_Vere who lives in Beckley. Those of a Roman Catholic persuasion who live in Woodeaton are within the parish of St. Anthony of Padua; while for those in Elsfield the parish is Corpus Christi. Both of these churches are in Headington, Oxford. Woodeaton is a quaint, aisle_less church with a box pew. Its most interesting possession is a 14th century wall-painting of St. Christopher fording the stream with fishes at his feet. He is carrying the Child and over his shoulder is a scroll in Norman French.
